SENT.plain: SIRT1 regulates a variety of cellular functions, including cellular stress responses and energy metabolism
SIRT1 activity is negatively regulated by DBC1 (Deleted in Breast Cancer 1) through direct binding
However, how the DBC1-SIRT1 interaction is regulated remains unclear
We found that the DBC1-SIRT1 interaction increases following DNA damage and oxidative stress
The stress-induced DBC1-SIRT1 interaction requires the ATM-dependent phosphorylation of DBC1 at Thr 454, which creates a second binding site for SIRT1
Finally, we showed that the stress-induced DBC1-SIRT1 interaction is important for cell fate determination following genotoxic stress
These results revealed a novel mechanism of SIRT1 regulation during genotoxic stress
